definition: magnitude of value/labor value (in economics, the labor inherent in a commodity)
value/(to be) worth/to happen to/to be on duty
capacity/quantity/amount/to estimate/abbr. for 量詞|量词[liang4 ci2], classifier (in Chinese grammar)/measure word

sentences.english: The phenomenon that the living labor decreases while the magnitude of value increases is still an academic mystery.
sentences.chinese: 活勞動減少而價值量增加，至今是一個理論“謎團”。

sentences.english: How, then, is the magnitude of this value to be measured ?
sentences.chinese: 那末，它的價值量是怎樣計量的呢？
